thread.title: Stenographer faints into podium as McConnell wraps...
thread.title_full: Stenographer faints into podium as McConnell wraps...

title: Stenographer faints into podium as McConnell wraps...
text:
More 
A stenographer collapsed in the well of the U.S. Senate Monday afternoon, prompting a brief, unplanned recess. 
The stenographer, a woman, appeared to faint as Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., concluded his opening floor remarks. 
McConnell exclaimed, "Oh my goodness." 
A few seconds later, the Senate ajourned for a brief recess. It gaveled back into session a few minutes later. 
According to Senate officials, the woman is receiving medical care. 
Stenographers stand in the well of the Senate, in close proximity to the lawmaker who is speaking, and record every word spoken during the session. Confirmed: Stenographer collapsed on floor of U.S. Senate. She is receiving medical care now. Chamber recessed briefly, now back in session.— Susan Ferrechio (@susanferrechio) March 13, 2017 The incident happened very suddenly, at the end of @SenateMajLdr opening remarks. McConnell said "Oh my goodness," Then Senate recessed.— Susan Ferrechio (@susanferrechio) March 13, 2017 Someone appears to have fainted on he Senate floor, possibly the stenographer. They have recessed to deal with the situation.— Susan Ferrechio (@susanferrechio) March 13, 2017
